Command.Name: Read Primary Variable
Command.Description: Read primary: level or interface in its engineering units

Command.Name: Read Current
Command.Description: Read PV: current and percentage of range

Command.Name: Reset Configuration Changed Flag
Command.Description: Resets the "configuration changed" flag for the HART master that sent the command. Doesn not affect the flag for the alternative master.

Command.Name: Clear Faults
Command.Description: Clears all faults that can be cleared

Command.Name: Clear Event
Command.Description: Clears the specified event (fault) if it can be cleared

Command.Name: Cancel Process
Command.Description: Abort the running process.\n NOTE: It is a COMMAND command by its idea, but it is allowed even if a process is running (which is the purpose)

Variable.Name: Tempr Units
Variable.Description: Temperature Units

Variable.Name: Process Id
Variable.Description: Id of the running process. 0 is reserved to indicate no process running

Variable.Name: Percent Complete
Variable.Description: Completion degree of a running process. Not all processes report a meaningful number

Variable.Name: Buffer Id
Variable.Description: An id of the buffer to read. Should be 0 (or 0x80|0) except special cases agreed with an application function

Variable.Name: Buffer Read Tag
Variable.Description: A "handshake" value between request and response to synchronize response with requests

Variable.Name: Buffer Data
Variable.Description: Data read from the buffer. You need to know the meaning of the data which is specific to the context filling the buffer.

Variable.Name: Raw Data Samples
Variable.Description: Byte stream read from the buffer. You need to know the meaning of the data which is specific to the context filling the buffer.

Variable.Name: Buffer Read Length
Variable.Description: The actual number of valid 16-bit items read in Buffer Data

Variable.Name: Data Sample Count
Variable.Description: The actual number of valid samples read in Buffer Data

Variable.Name: Data Sample Skip Count
Variable.Description: Number of samples to skip (0 means consecutive read)

Variable.Name: Data Sample Size
Variable.Description: Size of a sample in bytes

Variable.Name: Data Offset
Variable.Description: Read offset into the raw buffer (auto-incerementing)

Variable.Name: Buffer Data Long
Variable.Description: Data read from the buffer. You need to know the meaning of the data which is specific to the context filling the buffer.

Variable.Name: Device Submode
Variable.Description: Device submode is a bitwise OR of zero or more of the following: NORMAL 00 Low Power 10 Marginal Power 40 Fail high 80 Trip state 20 - Trip means that the device is not necessarily in failsafe but outputs failsafe output because it is so configured to annunciate certain external conditions.

Variable.Name: Device Mode
Variable.Description: Device mode

Variable.Name: Device InvMode
Variable.Description: Inverted device mode for transmission redundancy

Variable.Name: Position
Variable.Description: Device-specific position, like valve position in AP or interface or level in DLT

Variable.Name: Signal
Variable.Description: Loop current (in positioners - measured; in transmitters - commanded)

Variable.Name: Signal Percent
Variable.Description: Signal Percent

Command.Name: Read Data Buffer Raw
Command.Description: Reads raw data from a linear buffer. NOTE: This command is intentionally made a COMMAND command so that it can't work unless the running process allows it.

Command.Name: Reset
Command.Description: Resets the device after sending the response

Command.Name: Read Settings
Command.Description: Reads settings selected by the subcommand

Command.Name: Read Advanced Output Switch Config
Command.Description: Read Output Switch Configuration

Command.Name: Read Output Switch Config
Command.Description: Read Output Switch Configuration

Command.Name: Read UI language
Command.Description: Read UI language

Command.Name: Read UI Access Control
Command.Description: Read buttons lock and override password

Command.Name: Read Level Alarm Settings
Command.Description: Read settings of the specified Level Alarm

Command.Name: Read Level Alarm Hysteresis
Command.Description: Read Hysteresis for the Level Alarms

Command.Name: Write Settings
Command.Description: Writes settings selected by the subcommand - Allowed modes must be selected by corresponding subcommand

Command.Name: Write Advanced Output Switch Config
Command.Description: Write Output Switch Configuration

Command.Name: Write Output Switch Config
Command.Description: Write Output Switch Configuration

Command.Name: Write UI language
Command.Description: Write UI language

Command.Name: Write UI Access Control
Command.Description: Write buttons lock and override password

Command.Name: Write Level Alarm Settings
Command.Description: Write settings of the specified Level Alarm

Command.Name: Write Level Alarm Hysteresis
Command.Description: Write Hysteresis setting for the Level Alarms

Command.Name: Losslessly Read Data Buffer
Command.Description:
Reads data from a circular buffer (in 16-bit quantities)\n - Additional flag in Buffer Id (MSB set means the following tag is the start tag of the read session\n - Additional byte (tag) which is an arbitrary value if MSB is set, or (previous_value+1)%256 otherwise\n\n
If MSB is set, the device will (by convention) reply "transmitter-specific error" to save on transmission time.
Otherwise, if MSB is cleared, the device will compare the byte with the previous value.
If the value is the same, the device will assume a retry and repeat the previous response
If the value is (previous_value+1)%256, the device will send a new batch of data
In either case the device will mirror the tag.
In all other cases the device will assume the session is wrong and return "invalid selection"
Command would read from the same buffer until the buffer is changed with MSB set.

Command.Name: Check Process
Command.Description: Get information on the running process

Command.Name: Change Device Mode
Command.Description: Change device mode

Command.Name: Read Device Mode
Command.Description: Read device mode and submode

Command.Name: Reset To Factory Calibrations
Command.Description: Reset a calibration item specified by a subcommand

Command.Name: Read User Trim
Command.Description: Read user trim values specified by a subcommand\n NOTE: None of the parameters are device variables: they have to pull around to stick.

Command.Name: Run a Process
Command.Description: Executes the requested process

Variable.Name: DO Under Config
Variable.Description: 0-based DO number (0-DO1, 1-DO2). Not all DO in all projects are configurable.

Variable.Name: DO Normal State
Variable.Description: Normal (not asserted) state of the DO. 0-normal closed, 1-normal open

Variable.Name: DO Modes map
Variable.Description: When the device mode is m, the DO is asserted if bit # m is set in this byte (mask 1<<m).

Variable.Name: DO Fault attributes map
Variable.Description: When there is any fault (status) with an attribute a, the DO is asserted if bit # a is set in this byte (mask 1<<a).

Variable.Name: Detailed Faults Map
Variable.Description: Bit array of Status (Event/Alarm/Fault) bits that assert the associated output switch (DO)

Variable.Name: UI Language
Variable.Description: UI Language code

Variable.Name: UI Lock Level
Variable.Description: From all enabled to all disabled. NOTE: No useful decoding until common enums are shared.

Variable.Name: UI Password Enabled Flag
Variable.Description: 0 disabled, 1 enabled, others invalid

Variable.Name: UI password
Variable.Description: Any number can be a password

Variable.Name: Alarm Selector
Variable.Description: 0 to number-of-alarms - 1.\n NOTE: Same variables are populated for different values of selector so they should be pulled around programmatically

Variable.Name: Alarm Enabled
Variable.Description: 0-disabled, non-0-enambled

Variable.Name: Alarm Threshold
Variable.Description: Alarm threshold in the current units of level/position

Variable.Name: Alarm Hysteresis
Variable.Description: Alarm treshold hysteresis in the current units of level/position

Variable.Name: Alarm Time
Variable.Description: Time outside thresholds before alarm is set; or inside the thresholds before the alarm is cleared

Variable.Name: DO Function
Variable.Description: One of the predefined functions for a DO simplified configurations.\n NOTE: Not all values apply to all projects

EnumValues.v5: SWITCH_POS_LOW_1 | Alarm Low1 | Tied to Alarm 1
EnumValues.v6: SWITCH_POS_HIGH_1 | Alarm High1| Tied to Alarm 3
EnumValues.v10: SWITCH_OFFLINE | Not Normal Mode | Not in normal mode
EnumValues.v12: SWITCH_POS_LOW_2 | Alarm Low2 | Tied to Alarm 2
EnumValues.v13: SWITCH_POS_HIGH_2 | Alarm High2 | Tied to Alarm 4
EnumValues.v15: SWITCH_UI_OFF | Local UI off | UI off because of low temperature (or disconnect)

Command.Description: Autimatically tune the control algorithm

Command.Description: Sets the tuning parameters and optionally runs the tuning algorithm

Variable.Name: Tune Flags
Variable.Description:
For SVi1000 the flag has no effect.
 Future plans:
 Bit 0 if set skips step 3 of tune algorithm
 Bit 1 if set starts tuning from default settings

Variable.Name: Tune Completion Code
Variable.Description: 0 if not run or success, other TBD

EnumValues.v0: TCCNot Run or Success | Not Run or Success
EnumValues.v46: TCCFAIL_PADJ_TOO_BIG | P gain adjustment above limit
EnumValues.v32767: TCCSizer | Do not use; for guaranteed enum size only

Variable.Name: eadc_MaxErr

Variable.Name: eadc_PosComp

Variable.Name: eadc_P_element
Variable.Description: P (Proportional)term of PID control

Variable.Name: eadc_D_element

Variable.Name: eadc_Boost_element
Variable.Description: Boost component of the control algorithm

Variable.Name: eadc_Fast_elements
Variable.Description: Total of fast-acting components of the control algorithm.\nThe sum of P, D -terms and Boost; Integral is excluded.

Variable.Name: eadc_Integral
Variable.Description: Momentary value of Integral component

Variable.Name: eadc_Bias
Variable.Description: Momentary value of Bias

Variable.Name: eadc_Overshoots
Variable.Description: Number of overshoots

Variable.Name: eadc_JigglesPassed
Variable.Description: Number of passed jiggle tests

Variable.Name: eadc_CalcPeriod
Variable.Description: Period of adding Integral to Bias (counted in control periods).

Variable.Name: eadc_IntegalCount
Variable.Description: Number of cycles since last addition integral to bias (reset to 0 when added)

Variable.Name: eadc_CtrlByte
Variable.Description: A single-byte bit pattern, reflecting a number of control parameters

Variable.Name: eadc_BitPack
Variable.Description: A two-byte bit pattern, reflecting a number of process parameters

Variable.Name: eav_Version
Variable.Description: A 2-UINT long version of the command Extended Analysis.\nFirst word - FW version (example: B-5 for beta-5);\n2nd word - the command version within FW version, or zero.

Variable.Name: eapp_posScaled

Variable.Name: eapp_temperRaw

Variable.Name: eapp_temperTCcomp
Variable.Description: TC compensated temperature (divide by 100 to obtain value in degrees C)

Command.Name: Read Conversion Coefficients
Command.Description:
Read parameters for converting from external representation (floating point) to internal (integer) and back.
 Let x be internal number and X external. The conversion formulas are as follows:
 X = (i2f_slope*(x - Xintercept)*2**(-i2f_shift) + Yintercept)/(10**order)
 y = round(X*10**order)
 If y does not fit 32-bit integer, reject
 x = round(f2i_slope*(y-Yintercept)*2**(-f2i_shift) + Xintercept)

Variable.Name: HFP_i2f_slope
Variable.Description: Scaling coefficeient (see command description)

Variable.Name: HFP_Xintercept
Variable.Description: Scaling coefficeient (see command description)

Variable.Name: HFP_Yintercept
Variable.Description: Scaling coefficeient (see command description)

Variable.Name: HFP_i2f_shift
Variable.Description: Scaling coefficeient (see command description)

Variable.Name: HFP_order
Variable.Description: Scaling coefficeient (see command description)

Variable.Name: HFP_f2i_slope
Variable.Description: Scaling coefficeient (see command description)

Variable.Name: HFP_f2i_shift
Variable.Description: Scaling coefficeient (see command description)

Variable.Name: HFP_UnitsCode
Variable.Description: HART units code

Variable.Name: HFP_Dimension
Variable.Description: Id of a physical quantity (position, signal, pressure etc.)

Command.Name: Read Temperatures
Command.Description: Reads current, min and max temperatures of all the sensors

Variable.Name: Manual Find Stops Step
Variable.Description: Sequence step in manual find stops

Command.Name: Read TempComp Points
Command.Description: Read temperature cal points at which measurements/calculations were made

Command.Name: Read TempComp Row
Command.Description: Read temperature cal OffsetSpan cells (as 16- or 32-bit entries)

Command.Name: Write TempComp Row
Command.Description: Write temperature cal OffsetSpan cells (as 16- or 32-bit entries) NOTE: No tempcomp is not written to NVMEM automatically. Instead, when you have written all channels (and only you know what all means), you should commit RAM to NVMEM for the NVMEM volume(s) affected.

Command.Name: Write TempComp Points
Command.Description: Write temperature cal points at which measurements/calculations were made. NOTE: No tempcomp is not written to NVMEM automatically. Instead, when you have written all channels (and only you know what all means), you should commit RAM to NVMEM for the NVMEM volume(s) affected.

Command.Name: Enable All AD Channels
Command.Description: Used for board calibration only

Variable.Name: Number of Points
Variable.Description: Number of temperature calibration points (common to all channels on the selected board)

Variable.Name: TempPoint
Variable.Description: Temperature at the temperature cal point in the "raw" sensor representation. For DLT, a measurement offset by some number TBD to make it unsigned.

Variable.Name: Tempr Offset
Variable.Description: An artificial offset to make temperature an unsigned value. Absolutely must match the firmware value (or the write will fail)

Variable.Name: Board Number
Variable.Description: 0-Main board, 1-Sensor board

Variable.Name: TC Offset16
Variable.Description: offset in 16-bit tempcomp calculation

Variable.Name: TC Span16
Variable.Description: span (slope) in 16-bit tempcomp calculation

Variable.Name: TC Offset32
Variable.Description: offset in 32-bit tempcomp calculation

Variable.Name: TC Span32
Variable.Description: span (slope) in 32-bit tempcomp calculation

Variable.Name: Channel Shift
Variable.Description: Common right-shift value for a tempcomp row

Variable.Name: TempComp16 tag
Variable.Description: A tag of a 16-bit tempcomp channel

Variable.Name: TempComp32 tag
Variable.Description: A tag of a 32-bit tempcomp channel

Variable.Description: An X or Y (depending on XorY) point in mapping [0-100]% (0-16384) on itself

XVariable.Name: Fine Charact Xpoint
XVariable.Description: An X point in mapping [0-100]% (0-16384) on inself for fine segments

Command.Name: Read Setpoint
Command.Description: Reads setpoint

Command.Name: Write Setpoint
Command.Description: Writes settings selected by the subcommand

Command.Name: Write Custom Characterization
Command.Description: Write custom Characterization. Endpoints (0%,0%) and (100%, 100%) are implied

Command.Name: Select SP Characterization
Command.Description: Select Setpoint/Position Characterization

Command.Name: Read SP Characterization Selection
Command.Description: Read SP and Position Characterization Selection

Command.Name: Read SP Characterization
Command.Description: Read coarse reference points of Custom Characterization

Command.Name: Read SP Characterization X or Y
Command.Description: Read coarse reference points of Custom Characterization

XCommand.Name: Commit Custom Characterization
XCommand.Description: Commit previously written Custom SP Characterization to NVMEM

Variable.Name: Set Effective Block Mode As Target
Failed State Flag
Variable.Description: 0 if not failed, 1 if failed

Variable.Name: Inversely Characterized Position
Variable.Description: Valve position in digital setpoint domain

Variable.Name: Characterized Digital Setpoint
Variable.Description: Effective digital setpoint in position domain

Variable.Name: TB FixedSetpoint
Variable.Description: Effective default digital setpoint

Variable.Name: TB ShedTime
Variable.Description: Shed Time of default digital setpoint

Variable.Name: TB InitTime
Variable.Description: Initial Shed Time of default digital setpoint

ResponseParams.Param: Set Effective Block Mode As Target

Command.Name: Reset Log File System
Command.Description: Removes all log file data

Command.Name: Read Log File
Command.Description: Reads up to 40 bytes from a log file

Variable.Name: File Id
Variable.Description: File Id is specific to the device and is documented elsewhere

Variable.Name: File Version
Variable.Description: "Age" of the file, 0 being the newest, 1 next to newest etc. The number of versions kept in the device is specific to the file.

Variable.Name: File Position
Variable.Description: Offset from the beginning of the file where the read begins

Variable.Name: File Read Length
Variable.Description: The actual number of valid bytes read in File Data

Variable.Name: File Data
Variable.Description: Data read from the file. You need to know the meaning of the data which is specific to the file id.

Command.Name: Read Diagnostic Signature Into Diagnostic Buffer

Variable.Name: Diag Control Option
Variable.Description: Open or closed loop

Variable.Name: Signature Type
Variable.Description: (For future expansion)

Variable.Name: Signature Assignment
Variable.Description: Save As... parameter

Variable.Name: Setpoint Ramp Speed
Variable.Description: Setpoint Ramp Speed in %/s

Variable.Name: Diag Direction
Variable.Description: Direction of signature - up, down or both

Variable.Name: Start Position
Variable.Description: Where the test begins

Variable.Name: End Position
Variable.Description: Where the test ends

Variable.Name: Sampling Time
Variable.Description: Sampling Time in s

Command.Name: Read reference voltage
Command.Description: Read the high limit and low limit of reference voltage

Command.Name: Write Factory Values
Command.Description: Write factory values and establish and cancel factory mode. All the work done by subcommands.

Command.Name: Write reference voltage
Command.Description: Write the high limit and low limit of reference voltage

Variable.Name: refvHiLimit
Variable.Description: High limit for reference voltage

Variable.Name: refvLoLimit
Variable.Description: Low limit for reference voltage

Variable.Name: Position Sensor Type
Variable.Description: Position Sensor Internal/External

Variable.Name: Sampling Interval
Variable.Description: Downsampling interval

Variable.Name: Reserved samples
Variable.Description: 2X numbers to keep must be stuffed into the buffer before start sampling

Variable.Name: Number Of Initial Points
Variable.Description: Pre-stuffed points; must match what was on susccessful "Start Sampling"

Variable.Name: Number Of Sampled Points
Variable.Description: Sampled points stored in the buffer

Variable.Name: Max Number Of Points To Keep
Variable.Description: Sampled points stored in the buffer

Variable.Name: Buffer Fill
Variable.Description: A value to write to a buffer

Variable.Name: Buffer Fill 2
Variable.Description: A value to write to a buffer

Command.Name: Write Data To Diag Buffer
Command.Description: Fill an entry in the requested diagnostic buffer (for testing purposes)

Command.Name: Write Sample To Diag Buffer
Command.Description: Fill a 2-entry sample in the requested diagnostic buffer (for testing purposes)

Command.Name: Start Sampling Into Diag Buffer
Command.Description: Initialize the buffer for sampling. Previously written samples are preserved up to Reserved samples

RequestParams.Param: Max Number Of Points To Keep

Command.Name: Stop Sampling Into Diag Buffer
Command.Description: End sampling

Command.Name: Read Diag Buffer Sampling Info
Command.Description: Read Diag Buffer Sampling Info

Command.Name: Read DO switches
Command.Description: Read DO switch: [0]=DO1, [1]=DO2

Command.Name: Write DO switches
Command.Description: Write DO switch: [0]=DO1, [1]=DO2

Variable.Name: DO Switch State
Variable.Description: DO Switch physical state (0 - closed; 1 - open)

Variable.Name: DO Switch Logical State
Variable.Description: DO Switch logical state (0 - inactive; 1 - active). Whether it is the same or opposite of physical state depends on "normal state" configuration

Command.Name: Save Nvmem As Factory Default
Command.Description: Starts a process to copy NVMEM standard image to a NVMEM log file

Command.Name: Restore Factory Default Nvmem
Command.Description: Starts a process to restore NVMEM standard image from a previously created NVMEM log file

Variable.Name: Nvmem Volume Id
Variable.Description: Volume id; 0 is always present, others project-dependent

Variable.Name: Nvmem Defaults Mask Flags
Variable.Description: Works together with Match Flags (see description); intended value is 0x04

Variable.Name: Nvmem Defaults Match Flags
Variable.Description: Works together with Mask Flags. Both 0's will restore everything. Other sensible values are for internal use. The logic is that the item is resored iff its (flags & mask) == match. The intended use is with value 0x04 (only NVMEM records designed to be restored)

Variable.Name: Nvmem Defaults Test Only
Variable.Description: 0 executes requested defaults; !=0 tests the defaults integrity

Command.Name: Clone Nvmem To Opposite Bank
Command.Description: Support of NVMEM cloning/translation for firmware download

Variable.Name: Cloning Completion Code
Variable.Description: 0 indicates success; non-0 failure

Variable.Name: NVMEM bank
Variable.Description: Where to read from /write to in NVMEM

Command.Name: Commit NVMEM Image From Diagnostic Buffer
Command.Description: A process to write the NVMEM image from the buffer to a NVMEM bank. What and where to write must be spelled out in the header of the buffer

Command.Name: Enable External Writes To Diagnostic Buffer
Command.Description: Just a dummy process to lock out other buffer clients.\nTo unlock, cancel the process, however, the intended use is to leave the process running and force replace it with Commit.

Command.Name: Read NVMEM To Diagnostic Buffer
Command.Description: Start a process to commit diagnostic buffer as NVMEM image.

Command.Name: External Write To Diagnostic Buffer
Command.Description: If external writes are not enabled, the command will be rejected\nThe command is non-compliant (doesn't return the values). So what?

Variable.Name: Data Collection Skip Count
Variable.Description: Distance between samples in multiples of cycle task periods (e.g. 105 ms)

Variable.Name: Data Collection Bitmap
Variable.Description:
Bitmap (mask) of what variables are collected
 POSITION = bit 0
 MAIN PRESSURE = bit 1
 PILOT PRESSURE = bit 2
 SUPPLY PRESSURE = bit 3
 PRESSURE B = bit 4
 SETPOINT = bit 5
 IP CURRENT = bit 6

Variable.Name: Data Collection Command
Variable.Description: What to do with data collection process

Command.Name: Read Key States
Command.Description: Read states of all 3 device buttons.

Command.Name: Control local UI
Command.Description: Use to emulate local UI via HART

Command.Name: Read UI language
Command.Description: Read UI language

Command.Name: Read UI Access Control
Command.Description: Read buttons lock and override password

Command.Name: Write UI language
Command.Description: Write UI language

Command.Name: Write UI Access Control
Command.Description: Write buttons lock and override password

Variable.Name: KeyStar
Variable.Description: State of the Select button

Variable.Name: KeyMinus
Variable.Description: State of the Minus button

Variable.Name: KeyPlus
Variable.Description: State of the Plus button

Variable.Name: EmulatedPushbuttons
Variable.Description: Bitmask of emulated keypad patterns

Variable.Name: LCD line 1
Variable.Description: An image of the LCD line

Variable.Name: LCD line 2
Variable.Description: An image of the LCD line

Variable.Name: LCD line 3
Variable.Description: An image of the LCD line

Variable.Name: UI Language
Variable.Description: UI Language code

Variable.Name: UI Password Enabled Flag
Variable.Description: 0 disabled, 1 enabled, others invalid

Variable.Name: UI Lock Level
Variable.Description: From all enabled to all disabled. NOTE: No useful decoding until common enums are shared.

Variable.Name: UI password
Variable.Description: Any number can be a password

Command.Name: Read Position Smoothing Coefficient
Command.Description: Read position/level smoothing coefficient (exponential forgetting value)

Command.Name: Read Expected NVMEM Signature
Command.Description: Read Expected NVMEM Signature

Command.Name: Read NVMEM area
Command.Description: Read a block of NVMEM. 2 MSB of "MemoryAddress" represent the volume number to read from (0-Main board, 1-Sensor board)

Command.Name: Read Firmware Version
Command.Description: Firmware CRC and build info

Command.Name: Write Factory Values
Command.Description: Write factory values and establish and cancel factory mode. All the work done by subcommands.

Command.Name: Write Position Smoothing Coefficient
Command.Description: Write position/level smoothing coefficient (exponential forgetting value)

Command.Name: Enable Factory Mode
Command.Description: Establishes factory mode if keys match; cancels it otherwise. Note: not subject to write locks

Command.Name: Write RAM area
Command.Description: Write a block of RAM

Command.Name: Write NVMEM area
Command.Description: Low-level write a block of NVMEM. 2 MSB of "MemoryAddress" represent the volume number to read from (0-Main board, 1-Sensor board)

Command.Name: Write Device Id
Command.Description: Factory Device Id

Command.Name: Commit RAM to NVMEM
Command.Description: Forces initialization of NVMEM from RAM image. Automatically repairs NVMEM signature. An NVMEM record is committed if its flags are such that ((flags ^ "Ram Commit Flip") & "RAM Commit Suppress") == 0. E.g. Suppress==0 commits all regardless of Flip; Suppress==0x02 commits calibrations if Flip==0x02 or everything except calibrations if Flip==0.

Command.Name: Clear NVMEM Signature
Command.Description: This (logically) destroys the NVMEM image thus producing a virgin unit

Command.Name: Clear Board Temperature
Command.Description: Clears min/max temperature record

Command.Name: Saturate Main Output
Command.Description: Sets main output (I/P or loop current) to min or max

Command.Name: Test Watchdog
Command.Description: Forces freezing the execution and watchdog expiration. Used for diagnosing the intended behavior of the watchdogs.

Variable.Name: AO channel number
Variable.Description: 0 - Retransmit Channel, 1 - Main Channel, others invalid

Variable.Name: Enable flag
Variable.Description: 0 - disabled, all others - enabled

Variable.Name: Direct Control Value
Variable.Description: Value in raw counts to send to AO

Variable.Name: ByteCount
Variable.Description: The number of raw bytes to write or read

Variable.Name: Output Flag
Variable.Description: Direction of output saturation: 0 - min non-0 - max

Variable.Name: Watchdog Id
Variable.Description: 0 - external watchdog non-0 - internal watchdog.

Variable.Name: RAM Commit Flip
Variable.Description: A bit set in this byte toggles the corresponding mark of an NVMEM record (see "RAM Commit Suppress".

Variable.Name: RAM Commit Suppress
Variable.Description: A bit set in this byte prevents commiting to NVMEM records marked with this bit. The corresponsing bit of "RAM Commit Flip" if set toggles the NVMEM record's mark. Currently supported bits: 0 (0x01) Configuration Changed and 1 (0x02) Calibration (common). More may be added.

Variable.Name: MemoryAddress
Variable.Description: Address of a memory block written to or read from the device

Variable.Name: ReadBlock
Variable.Description: Read buffer to hold the requested bytes

Variable.Name: WriteBlock
Variable.Description: Write buffer to hold the bytes to write

Variable.Name: BuildDate
Variable.Description: Build date string (for info only)

Variable.Name: Firmware CRC
Variable.Description: For information only

Variable.Name: NVMEM Volume Id
Variable.Description: NVMEM volume id (0-main board, 1-sensor board)

Variable.Name: Tempr Sensor Id
Variable.Description: Temperature Sensor Id: 0-main board, 1-sensor board (similar to NVMEM volume id)

Variable.Name: Final Assembly Date
Variable.Description: week-year\nyear = value%100+2000; week = value/100 \nNot used internally; just stored

Variable.Name: Factory Key 1
Variable.Description: A factory mode key

Variable.Name: Factory Key 2
Variable.Description: A factory mode key

Variable.Name: SmoothCoefPosition
Variable.Description: Exponent of forgetting coefficient

Variable.Name: NVMEM Signature
Variable.Description: Signature with layout number

Variable.Name: SubCmdNum
Variable.Description: Set to the value of this sub command number

Variable.Name: SubCmdNumEx
Variable.Description: Extended SubCmdNum

Variable.Name: RqstPadding
Variable.Description: Meaningless padding required by the format of the command

Variable.Name: RspPadding
Variable.Description: Meaningless padding required by the format of the command

Command.Name: Read Fault Code Masks
Command.Description: Read masks affecting "additional status available" in a HART response and command 48 response

Command.Name: Inject Fault
Command.Description: Forces the specified fault set as if it was detected. Used for testing the intended system behavior.

Command.Name: Write Fault Code Masks
Command.Description: Write masks affecting "additional status available" in a HART response and command 48 response

Command.Name: Read Addl Status
Command.Description: Reports current status information

Command.Name: Read Full Status
Command.Description: Reports unfiltered status information, current and history

Variable.Name: StatusArray1
Variable.Description: Public Status (Event/Alarm/Fault) bit array

Variable.Name: StatusArray2
Variable.Description: Public Status (Event/Alarm/Fault) bit array

Variable.Name: Ext Device Status
Variable.Description: 0 in HART 5

Variable.Name: H Operating Mode
Variable.Description: 0 in HART 5

Variable.Name: Fault Number
Variable.Description: 0 - no effect non-0 - a fault number (specific to the project's faults definitions).

Variable.Name: Fault Flag
Variable.Description: 1 - include history faults non-1 - exclude history faults

Variable.Name: CurrentStatus
Variable.Description: Status (Event/Alarm/Fault) bit array

Variable.Name: HistoryStatus
Variable.Description: Status (Event/Alarm/Fault) bit array

Variable.Name: Fault Code Mask In Status
Variable.Description: A fault bit corresponding to a set bit in this bit array affects the device status in HART response.

Variable.Name: Fault Code Mask In Report
Variable.Description: A fault bit corresponding to a set bit in this bit array is enabled in command 48 response.

Command.Name: Read Temperature Smoothing Coefficient
Command.Description: Read Temperature smoothing coefficient (exponential forgetting value)

Command.Name: Write Temperature Smoothing Coefficient
Command.Description: Write Temperture smoothing coefficient (exponential forgetting value)

Variable.Name: SmoothCoefTempr
Variable.Description: Exponent of forgetting coefficient

Command.Name: Set Pressure Controller Switch
Command.Description: Enable or disable (bypass) the analog Pressure Feedback Controller on I/P output path

Command.Name: Read Pressure Controller Bypass Switch state
Command.Description: Read Pressure Controller Bypass Switch state

Variable.Name: Bypass Request Flag
Variable.Description: 0-feedback (controller on), 1-no feedback (controller bypassed). 0 is the only value used during operation. 1 is used during calibration since no feedback is possible when the sensors are not connected to real valves.

EnumValues.v1: H BRF No Feedback | No Feedback

Variable.Name: Bypass Switch State
Variable.Description: 0-feedback (controller on), 1-no feedback (controller bypassed). This should match Bypass Request Flag if HW operates properly and the firmware doesn't override the request

EnumValues.v1: H BSS No Feedback | No Feedback

Command.Name: Read Actual States of Switches
Command.Description: Read hardare switches

Command.Name: Write Pressure Units
Command.Description: Write Pressure Units Selection

Command.Name: Read Pressure Units
Command.Description: Read Pressure Units Selection

Command.Name: Calibrate Pressures
Command.Description: I/O Channel calibration. All pressures are compensated for atmospheric pressure. Will turn into a subcommand as soon as support becomes available

Variable.Name: Pressure Units
Variable.Description: Pressure Units

Variable.Name: Pressure Zero Cal
Variable.Description:
Result of pressures zero trim.
 [0] = Actuator 1
 [1] = Actuator 2
 [2] = Supply
 [3] = Pilot
 Not all data may be applicable if channels are missing

Command.Name: Read Pressure Zero Trim
Command.Description: Reads parameters automatically computed during user calibration of pressures (see parameters)

Command.Name: Read DI Switch state
Command.Description: Read DI state

Variable.Name: Input Switch State
Variable.Description: DI Switch physical state (0 - closed; 1 - open, 2 - not available)
